Sentencas: The fabrication process for anode-supported thin-film solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) was investigated by using scalable and cost-effective methods.
Titulo: Scalable fabrication process of thin-film solid oxide fuel cells with an anode functional layer design and a sputtered electrolyte

Sentencas: The anode functional layer (AFL) was introduced on the surface of the substrate to stably deposit the thin-film electrolyte.
Titulo: Scalable fabrication process of thin-film solid oxide fuel cells with an anode functional layer design and a sputtered electrolyte

Sentencas: In previous studies, the AFL has been generally designed to increase the catalytic activity; however, in this study, additional design parameters including the roughness and density were controlled to achieve a pinhole-free thin-film electrolyte and structural stability.
Titulo: Scalable fabrication process of thin-film solid oxide fuel cells with an anode functional layer design and a sputtered electrolyte

Sentencas: Through the developed process, button and large-sized cells were fabricated, and the electrochemical performance evaluation showed potential power density and impedance values at relatively low operating temperature.
Titulo: Scalable fabrication process of thin-film solid oxide fuel cells with an anode functional layer design and a sputtered electrolyte

Sentencas: Microstructural analyses showed that each layer of the AFL, electrolyte, and cathode was uniformly coated on the substrate.
Titulo: Scalable fabrication process of thin-film solid oxide fuel cells with an anode functional layer design and a sputtered electrolyte

Sentencas: The thin-film electrolyte was densely deposited without cracks or pinholes.
Titulo: Scalable fabrication process of thin-film solid oxide fuel cells with an anode functional layer design and a sputtered electrolyte

Sentencas: The electrochemical performance and microstructure confirmed that the developed thin-film SOFCs are reliable and reproducible without costly processes or materials.
Titulo: Scalable fabrication process of thin-film solid oxide fuel cells with an anode functional layer design and a sputtered electrolyte
